result.execSummary:
The defendant Kezoshay D Christopher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $750 fine including all mandatory costs and DNA surcharge, by 02-24-16.  Failure to pay penalty is 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence, Huber to apply for work.
Court STAYED the commencement until 09-08-15.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kezoshay D Christopher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C CCommitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.  10 days HOC,  conscutive.  Due & owing

Defendant Kezoshay D Christopher in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencment until 9-8-15. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample. 
Fine of $750.00 including ALL MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge to be paid by 2-24-16 or serve 10 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Kezoshay D Christopher in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court. Defendant in court on 6/24/2015. Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case calendared for yesterday, but was not heard. Court held colloquy with counsel. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kezoshay D Christopher
Current: 4765 North 32nd Street #316, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 05-18-2015)
Prior: 4765 North 32nd Street #316, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Kezoshay D Christopher in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.vb
